text: Streniastis thermaea is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It was described by Oswald Bertram Lower in 1897. It is found in Australia, where it has been recorded from New South Wales and Tasmania. The wingspan is about 20 mm. The forewings are orange yellow, deeper on the margins. There is a fine line of fuscous at the apex. The hindwings are black.Proceedings of the Linnean Society of New South Wales. 22 (2): 271. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1897 Category:Dichomeridinae
title: Streniastis thermaea
